main.name: Arman Izadi
main.bio: I am a senior McGill student majoring in Software Engineering with a minor in Economics. I am expecting to graduate by December 2021. Currently, I work as a Product Agnostic Consultant with Functional and Technical experience at Big Bang 360 Inc. I am looking for Consulting, BA positions as well as more technical backend positions.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: Here is a short summary of my top skills

education.description: Engineering Undergraduate Society Board of Governor's Member at Large. - EUS Orientation Coordinator 2015 & 2016. - Electrical, Computer, Software Student Society U1 Class representative

work.title: Consultant
work.description: Working with a product agnostic company to provide cloud solutions including ERP, CRM and PSA. Products include Oracle Netsuite, Salesforce, Mavenlink, Hubspot. Experience leading client-facing analysis and working sessions for implementation requirements. Part of long-term implementation project from start to go live, including integrations between systems. Point person on support projects. A key resource for Revenue Recognition, Accounts Payable, Dunning expert and Mavenlink API. Writing JavaScript custom scripts for Oracle Netsuite instances. Created Custom Revenue Recognition module (Netsuite ARM replacement). Created custom import tool hosted on Google Sheets using Mavenlink API. Trained with Salesforce Apex Scripts in addition.

work.title: FQA Senior Tester
work.description: Agile work environment. Responsibilities included: client communication (Slack/Skype, standups), task management (JIRA), team management (21 testers), daily reports/deliverables, administrative organization (Excel VBA scripts for task tracking, reporting).

work.title: Web Developer and Registration Assistant
work.description: Setting up Stripe Gateway on WordPress site to handle $700k worth of Orientation Week Payments, using PHP webhooks and token/call system. Updating Website content and aesthetics with custom CSS, JS scripts on WordPress Framework. Writing PHP scripts to integrate Caldera Forms into 2019 registration website, specifically to query and validate identification codes against SQL database, server side.

work.title: Orientation Coordinator
work.description: Working in 12-person team with subcommittees to organize, plan and execute 4-5-day Engineering Orientation Week with a $80k+ budget. Corporate relations with sponsors, venues, event logistics, proactive responsibility for at-risk situations, crisis management and team management. Time management and organization during 3-month planning process.

projects.title: Kruskal, Disjointed sets and Greedy Algorithm

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
